clinical_study.brief_title: Metagenomic Analysis of Gut Microbiome in Preterm
clinical_study.official_title: Metagenome Analysis of Intestinal Microbiome in Mortality and Morbidity of Preterm Infants

brief_summary.textblock: This is single center study. The investigators will try to know that relationships between intestinal microbiome and mortality in preterm infants and what relationships is between intestinal microbiome in preterm infants and morbidity, mortality.

detailed_description.textblock: Microbiome is the collection of all the microorganisms living in association with the human body which are consist of eukaryotes, archaea, bacteria and viruses. Microbiome in an average human body number are ten times more than human cells and have about 1000 more genes than are present in the human genome. There are symbiotic relationships between human and microbiome. If investigators are able to know about relationships between newborn and intestinal microbiome, mortality and morbidity in preterm infants may be improved. The investigators will collect the first and weekly stool of participants and analyze DNA of microbiome thorough Metagenomic anlysis. The results between 3 groups(preterm, late preterm and full-term infants) will be compared. The investigators expect that a mean distribution of intestinal microbiome in newborns(preterm, late preterm and full-term) is defined and that relationships between mortality, morbidity and intestinal microbiome.

primary_outcome.description: The distribution rate of intestinal microbiome of stool by K-mer based taxonomic assignment which is one of the analysis in result of metagenomics in each infants

secondary_outcome.measure: Full Enteral feeding in preterm infants
secondary_outcome.description: Days to accomplish a full-enteral feeding in each infants
Days to reach 2 kg of body weight in each infants
Number of patients who died in neonatal intensive care unit.
Number of patients who had a complication of preterm infants(e.g. necrotizing enterocolitis, bronchopulmonary dysplasia) or were died in neonatal intensive care unit.
Number of patients who were developed a allergic predisposition at 6 month of postnatal age.

arm_group.description: newborn infants were born with a gestational age of less than 32 weeks
newborn infants were born with a gestational age of greater than 32 weeks and less than 36 weeks
newborn infants were born with a gestational age of greater than or equal to 37 weeks

biospec_descr.textblock: extraction microbiome DNA from stool of newborns

study_pop.textblock: newborn infants who were born and admitted on neonatal intensive care unit of Wonju Severance Christian Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- preterm infants who were born at gestational age of less than 36 weeks from approval date to Feb 28th 2019
- full-term infants who were born at gestational age of greater than 37 weeks from approval date to Feb 28th 2019
Exclusion Criteria:
- newborns with congenital anomaly
- newborns with genetic syndrome
- newborns without consent of parents
